homophily-measures

Source: vignettes/homophily-measures.Rmd
homophily-measures.Rmd
library(spIBDerverse)
library(igraph)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'igraph'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     decompose, spectrum
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     union

In this vignette, we look at a method to identify edges that are more prominent than expected if the nodes attributes had not effect on the probability of an edge.

Consider a network with NN nodes and EE edges. From this, we get that the probability at two randomly selected nodes have an edge connected them is

pij=E(N2) p_{ij} = \frac{E}{{N \choose 2}} 

obs <- example_network |> get_ringbauer_measures("site")

Developed by Jono Tuke, Adam B. Rohrlach, Wolfgang Haak.
